label: System Architecture
summary: High-level overview of the system components
description: This mindmap represents the major components and their relationships within the system. Each branch explores a different architectural concern.

children.label: Frontend
children.description: The frontend handles all user interactions, rendering, and client-side state management. It communicates with backend services via APIs.

children.label: Components
children.description: Modular components that can be composed to build complex interfaces. Each component manages its own rendering logic.

children.label: State Management
children.description: Centralized state that drives the UI. Changes to state trigger re-renders of affected components.

children.label: Routing
children.description: Maps URLs to specific views and handles browser history integration.

children.label: Backend
children.description: The backend processes requests, enforces business logic, and manages data persistence. It exposes APIs consumed by the frontend.

children.label: API Layer
children.description: Receives incoming requests, validates input, and routes to appropriate handlers. Returns structured responses.

children.label: REST Endpoints
children.description: Standard REST endpoints for CRUD operations on system resources.

children.label: Validation
children.description: Ensures incoming data meets expected formats and constraints before processing.

children.label: Services
children.description: Contains the main application logic. Services are called by the API layer and interact with the data layer.

children.label: Data Layer
children.description: Abstracts database operations. Handles queries, transactions, and data mapping.

children.label: Infrastructure
children.description: The infrastructure layer covers hosting, deployment pipelines, monitoring, and operational concerns.

children.label: Hosting
children.description: Cloud or on-premise servers that host the application. Includes load balancing and scaling configuration.

children.label: CI/CD
children.description: Automated pipelines that build, test, and deploy code changes to various environments.

children.label: Monitoring
children.description: Collects logs, metrics, and traces. Triggers alerts when anomalies are detected.
